Sensor Class Reference

A class for all the sensors: GPS, PSI, RFID This is a wrapper class of the serial operations defined in serial.h and serial.cpp , together with some error state trackings. More...

Detailed Description

A class for all the sensors: GPS, PSI, RFID This is a wrapper class of the serial operations defined in serial.h and serial.cpp , together with some error state trackings.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Sensor::Sensor ( const char *  aName,
const char *  aPort,
bool  aNmea,
int  aMode 
)

A Constructor. The serialHandle will be initialized when Connect function is called.

All error flags will be reset.

Sensor::~Sensor ( )

Member Function Documentation

void Sensor::Close ( )

Close the handle.

bool Sensor::Connect ( )

Connect to the serial port and set the serial handle.

Returns:
0 if succeeded, positive integer otherwise.
void Sensor::Flush ( )
int Sensor::Receive ( char  buf[],
int  min,
int  max 
)

Receive bytes from the serial ports and store it to a buffer. If fails, it tries to reconnect to the port by calling the Connect function.

Parameters:
bufThe buffer to store the data from the sensor.
minThe minimum bytes to read.
maxThe maximum bytes to read.
Returns:
0 if succeeded, positive integer otherwise.
void Sensor::ResetAllErrorStates ( )

Reset all the error states.

void Sensor::ResetErrorState ( long  errorFlag)

Reset the error flag.

int Sensor::Send ( const char *  cmd)

Send a message to the serial port. If fails, it tries to reconnect to the port by calling the Connect function.

Parameters:
cmdThe message to be sent.
Returns:
0 if succeeded, positive integer otherwise.
void Sensor::SetErrorState ( long  errorFlag)

Set the error flag.

void Sensor::UpdateSensorState ( )

Send a message to update the sensor state.
